body: I mean... He could have just "Disposed" of her, without being cocky, and it would have been fine
Well thats a fair end to be saying
Yeah, AN is how I figured it worked

The way I see it, it's just that the time stop naturally wasn't indefinite. Otherwise time would've never started flowing again in the first place.
Rather, the stopwatch breaks-> He can't fix it-> He dies of natural causes whilst desperately trying to fix it->His body experiences a couple thousand or so years of time->The watch's power finally runs out and Voila, a desiccated corpse
Lowkey happy he got what he deserved.

Let's see here...he probably got affected with the "Rebound" effect. Obviously such a thing couldn't just magically function without a power source, however that wasn't a problem when it was still working properly. So when the watch broke it overloaded, as we can see at how the arms of the watch turn fast. The overload caused a different effect, which means the time didn't stop for him, he was exiled from time, time continued on without him and only reappeared again when he fixed the watch (somehow with just tapes? Is that flex seal?), too bad for him it took tremendous amount of power just to bring him back to the plane of time. Bringing someone back requires more power than throwing them out, so as exchanged he prolly got his power sucked out, so he dried out. They only said mummified because his corpse is still intact despite being dry out of its mass.

The ending is a confusing. The missing groceries suggest he lived a lifetime but the mummification suggests time didn't start back up until long after he died. Strange. But still fappable.

That Ending sucked. Would have been better if he was sent back to real time, not "mummified" with a taped up stopwatch. 

He could have lived till he was an old man, unrecognizable, and learned to fix the watch. Since we learned things he is touching aren't affected by the time stop, he could have found a way. 

He could have also just dropped the watch and been put back in real time too theoretically. Also the mummified implies he found a way out only after death with no oxygen for years.
